episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical topics, including the origins of Popeye's powers, Marcel Proust's eccentricities, the etiquette of handkerchiefs, and the peculiarities of Tunnel of Love rides in theme parks.

facts.fact: Originally Popeye, the sailor man, got his powers, not from eating spinach, but by rubbing a lucky magic hen.
Marcel Proust once woke up the members of a famous string quartet at midnight and made them all come back to his house to play a specific piece for him.
In the 1920s, a smart young man would have two handkerchiefs, a blower and a shower.
In the 1960s, owners of a theme park in Pennsylvania had guards with plastic bats in the Tunnel of Love ride who were instructed to give an admonishing thwack to any bear bums that they saw.
